Articles.Content:
Ever thought that wheels were too efficient? Want to hypothetically climb onto the back of things? Figure out why Active Texture Management keeps compressing Infernal Robotics? This probe is for you!

I made this when I was trying to figure out how TARS walks in Interstellar. Turns out it's a really hard movement to mimic.

I tried getting it to climb the SPH stairs. Did you know it takes like 20 minutes to get from the launch pad to the SPH with this thing?

How to use:

Hold K (or whatever you want to set it to) to retract the legs and rotate them forward.

Hold H to extend the legs and rotate them backward, usually pulling you along.

Repeat. Remember to use your reaction wheels. If you fall, you can easily get back up (the only real advantage over a wheeled rover).

Requirements:

Infernal Robotics and the Model Rework Expansion.

Patience.

Craft file
get kOS, then you can program a sequence of motions to loop continuosly with a button press, instead of QWOP'ing all over the place
